result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlayna A Jives was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.574(1).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.574(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to Defendant's employment or residence, specifically Milwaukee County.  
Court approves electronic monitoring within the rules of the Jail.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Time shall be served consecutively to Ct. 5 and with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to Defendant's employment or residence, specifically Milwaukee County.
Consecutive to: Ct. 5

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with Tyler Schroeder.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall have no contact with any establishments where drugs are illegally purchased, consumed or sold.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.

Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Resolution reached with both sides free to argue; State moves to amend Cts. 5 and 6 to Deliver Drug Paraphernalia as a PTAC pursuant to sec. 961.574 (1) and 939.05 and Court so orders.  State further moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 7 and 8.  Guilty plea entered on amended Cts. 5 and 6.  Court finds def guilty on amended Cts. 5 and 6 and orders Cts. 7 and 8 dismissed and read in.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Per request of ADA Sandra Giernoth and upon no objection from Atty. Jaeger, 2-18-15 jury status hearing rescheduled from 3:45 a.m. to 9:45 a.m.  No written notice will follow.
Jury status hearing on February 18, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Statements by counsel.  Atty. Jaeger indicates his client wishes to retain alternate counsel through the SPD.  Court denies any motion to withdraw or substitution of counsel.  Court would likely consider this request further in the event the co-defendant Schroeder case proceeds to trial as it would result in an adjournment of this trial.  Court will grant adjournment of jury status.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
State's Notice of Motions & Motions in Limine
Due to a conflict on the Court's calendar, 2-12-15 Jury status hearing rescheduled to 2-11-15 at 10:00 a.m.
Jury status hearing on February 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  State does not oppose motion for severance.  Argument by counsel.  Court grants motion to sever.  Motions in limine to be filed two weeks prior to trial.  Court will require counsel to disclose expert witnesses, CV's, as well as any summary of proposed testimony two weeks prior to trial.  Two day jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger appearing for Def.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Case called at 10:40 a.m.  Court issues a capias and bail forfeiture.  Defendant appears in Court at 10:44 a.m.; Court withdraws capias and bail forfeiture previously ordered.  Motion to sever previously filed.  Amended Information filed and reading waived.  Hearing on Bruton and severance scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 8:30 a.m.

State appears by Atty Giernoth. Appearance of counsel and Defendant previously excused by the Court. (kd)  Case tagging for purposes of scheduling w/ co-defendant cases 14CF86 & 14CF8; Hearing scheduled October 3, 2014 at 10:30 a.m.
Motion hearing on July 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A Jaeger.  Atty Sandra Giernoth appeared for the State.  Statements by counsel.  As to Defendant Parham, Court denies motion to sever Ct. 1 from charges in Cts. 3 and 4.  With respect to motion to sever as it pertains to Defendant Schroeder, counsel may file supplemental motion.  As to Defendants Parham and Schroeder, Court directs Miranda Goodchild motions and any supplemental severance motions to be filed no later than 7-11-2014.  Motion to sever Defendants as to Defendant Parham and Defendant Schroeder are held in abeyance. Miranda Goodchild hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 1:30 p.m.  Court will excuse Atty. Jaeger's appearance at the 7-25-14 hearing.
Letter dated 6/25/14 faxed to Atty Jaeger, Atty Borda, and Atty Christopherson at request of Branch 3 Judicial Assistant
Letter from Judge Todd K Martens to Atty Giernoth, Atty Jaeger, Atty Borda, and Atty Christopherson
Motion hearing on June 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A Jaeger.  Atty Sandra J Giernoth appeared for State. Discovery materials were supplied to defense counsel today. If def is joining in motions filed in Parham case (14cf86), Atty Jaeger to submit by May 23, 2014. State to file response on motion to sever by May 30th; Atty Jaeger to file reply by June 16, 2014. Court will issue oral decision at next appearance. State requesting this motion be ruled on before other motions are scheduled. Motion hearing (Miranda) and Court's oral ruling on motion to sever scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Co-defendant case.  Amended criminal complaint filed and provided to defendants correcting typographical errors and known alias.  Defendants acknowledge receipt of amended criminal complaint.    Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State to file an Information.   Court orders defense motions be filed no later than 5-02-14.  Court may change adjourned date to accomodate a briefing schedule or evidentiary hearing on motions.  Arraignment scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A. Jaeger.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel rqst. opportunity to discuss preliminary hearing with defendant.  State prepared to proceed and rqst. to proceed to preliminary hearing.  Recess at 10:23 a.m.  Reconvene at 10:25 a.m.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Court grants adj. request of Preliminary hearing.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.Hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
